law.full_text:
POSTING OF PRIVATE STREETS.
At or near the entrance of each intersection of a private street with a dedicated public street or with another private street, there shall be erected and maintained by applicant a sign post to which is attached a sign having an area of at least 15 inches by 21 inches upon which is printed and clearly legible in at least 2–inch letters the name of the private street and the words “PRIVATE STREET,” in at least one-inch letters the words “NOT DEDICATED FOR PUBLIC USE OR MAINTAINED BY THE CITY OF L.A. (LAMC 18.07).” The words, letters and figures of the sign shall be arranged in substantially the following manner:
“(NAME OF STREET), PRIVATE STREET NOT DEDICATED FOR PUBLIC USE OR MAINTAINED BY CITY OF L.A. (L.A.M.C. 18.07)”

unit.catch_line: Private Streets, Lot Or Building Site Standards.

law.plain_text:
LOS ANGELES MUNICIPAL CODE
POSTING OF PRIVATE STREETS. (§ 18.07)
POSTING OF PRIVATE STREETS. At or near the entrance of each intersection of a private street with a dedicated public street or with another private street, there shall be erected and maintained by applicant a sign post to which is attached a sign having an area of at least 15 inches by 21 inches upon which is printed and clearly legible in at least 2–inch letters the name of the private street and the words “PRIVATE STREET,” in at least one-inch letters the words “NOT DEDICATED FOR PUBLIC USE OR MAINTAINED BY THE CITY OF L.A. (LAMC 18.07).” The words, letters and figures of the sign shall be arranged in substantially the following manner:“(NAME OF STREET), PRIVATE STREET NOT DEDICATED FOR PUBLIC USE OR MAINTAINED BY CITY OF L.A. (L.A.M.C. 18.07)”
